_comment: Created by NCODowd on 27/04/2016 10:33:21 using v2.7
title: How has the absolute number of adults joining NHS stop smoking services changed?
analysis_commentary: The absolute number of people setting a quit date gradually increased from 2003/04 to a peak of over 800,000 in 2011/12. Since then, the number has plummeted, hitting roughly 450,000 in 2014/15. Anecdotal evidence suggests that people increasingly smoke e-cigarettes in lieu of quitting. The declining prevalence of smoking may also contribute to the decreasing number of quitters, although this trend outlasts the period of decline.
data_source: Health and Social Care Information Centre, Statistics on NHS Stop Smoking Services
